intro: Compsoneura costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Central America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. The plant features a sympodial growth habit, with a rhizome that produces multiple shoots and leaves. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a variety of colors including white, yellow, and orange. Compsoneura costaricensis plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
